page.title: 07Craftsman in Stone
page.content:
There is a self-employed craftsman who lives in Middle Duntisbourne and has a small workshop where he makes and sells garden ornaments, tables, benches and staddle stones.
These are made from a mixture of cement and powdered limestone from Daglingworth Quarry which is poured into moulds and left to set. It is then turned out and given an antique finish by scouring and pitting the surface with a small trowel-shaped tool.
After a few days the article dries rock hard and is ready for sale. When it has been weathered for a few years it is difficult to tell the new from the genuine old stone ones.
